title: E. J. Jones (rugby union)
text:
E. J. Jones was a Cornish <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player who competed in the <a href="1908%20Summer%20Olympics">1908 Summer Olympics</a> at <a href="White%20City%20Stadium">White City Stadium</a>, <a href="London">London</a>. He was a member of the British rugby union team, which on 26 October 1908 won the Olympic silver medal for <a href="Great%20Britain">Great Britain</a>. He also played for <a href="Plymouth%20Albion%20R.F.C.">Plymouth Albion R.F.C.</a> and 18 times for <a href="Cornwall">Cornwall</a>.
He has also written an autobiography with Donald McRae titled "My Life and Rugby: The Autobiography".
